alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 9:07PM EDT until May 09 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 1 PM EDT MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 4 AM to 1 PM EDT Monday, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 4 AM EDT Monday, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Monday afternoon through late Monday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Water is expected to cover roads on St. Georges Island, be in yards, and approach structures. To the east, inundation is expected at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. Shoreline inundation up to one foot above ground is possible elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 8:16 AM and 9:03 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 9:02 PM and 9:03 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 9:38 PM and 9:39 AM. STRAITS POINT MD MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/09 PM 3.1 1.5 1.7 1.0 Minor 09/08 AM 3.5 1.9 2.1 1.0 Moderate 09/09 PM 3.5 1.9 2.1 1.0 Moderate 10/09 AM 3.6 2.0 2.2 1.0 Moderate 10/10 PM 3.6 2.0 2.2 1.0 Moderate 11/10 AM 3.3 1.7 1.9 1.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
